casebody.data:
FIRST NATIONAL BANK & TRUST COMPANY, of Kalamazoo, Michigan, a National Banking Corporation, Appellant, v. David E. UHL, Receiver of the Grand Rapids National Bank, Appellee. No. 7296. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Feb. 15, 1938. Knappen, Uhl, Bryant & Snow, of Grand Rapids, Mich., and Stearns, Klein-stuck & Stapleton, of Kalamazoo, Mich., for appellant. James T. McAllister, of Grand Rapids, Mich., for appellee.

Before MOORMAN and SIMONS, Circuit Judges, and NEVIN, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

Affirmed for the reasons stated by the District Judge in his opinion and upon his findings of fact which in our opinion are sufficiently supported by the proofs.

Judge MOORMAN participated in conference decision but died before preparation and announcement thereof.
